conclusion: Determine mechanical energy loss during collision between block C and block B.
Block C is moving with initial velocity v0 before collision.
Initial kinetic energy of block C is KE_initial = 1/2 m v0^2.
Block C travels distance s0 before colliding with block B.
Work done by friction on block C is W_friction = -mu m g s0.
Kinetic energy of block C just before collision is KE_before collision = 1/2 m v0^2 - mu m g s0.
During perfectly inelastic collision, block C and block B stick together and move with common velocity vf.
By conservation of momentum, vf = v_C before collision / 2.
Velocity of block C just before collision is v_C before collision = sqrt(v0^2 - 2 mu g s0).
Final kinetic energy of combined mass (C and B) after collision is KE_final = m (v0^2 - 2 mu g s0) / 4.
Mechanical energy loss during collision is Delta E = 1/4 m v0^2 - 1/2 mu m g s0.
Final answer: Mechanical energy loss during collision is Delta E = 1/4 m v0^2 - 1/2 mu m g s0.
